body: IN their widening search for value and space, many New York City house-hunters are turning to the middle of Brooklyn, to an oasis of large one-family houses, wide oak- and maple-lined streets, a small-town sense of community and reasonable prices. The area is Flatbush. But not the seedy Flatbush of Flatbush Avenue, nor the rows of attached two- and
title: HISTORIC FLATBUSH: A NEW FRONTIER FOR HOUSE-HUNTING
